400c19f1-16ed-4cde-ba71-a0d211fa1833 Industry groups and governments pledge to back new nuclearRepresentatives of the nuclear industry in OECD nations, and representatives of the governments of 20 countries, have issued communiqués committing to work together to expand nuclear energy capacity, after the inaugural <em>经合组织核能机构和法国政府组织的新核会议路线图。; Fri, 29 Sep 2023 11:22:07 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Nuclear-groups-and-ministers-pledge-to-back-new-nu?feed=feed
8e8fc695-bf40-435e-b1da-edcf02a8a2e1 Canadian and Romanian firms collaborate on medical isotopesLaurentis Energy Partners and Nuclearelectrica are to collaborate on the production of medical isotopes at the Cernavoda Nuclear Power Plant and explore the possibility of heavy water production in Romania. Fri, 29 Sep 2023 15:07:46 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Canadian-and-Romanian-firms-collaborate-on-medical?feed=feed
3d153e7a-30e4-4e56-a581-17a071660b33 Kazatomprom plans 2025 uranium production increaseThe board of the Kazakh uranium producer has approved a strategy to increase production volumes in 2025, returning to a 100% level relative to its subsoil use agreements for the first time since 2018 and adding up to 6,000 tU to anticipated global primary supply. Fri, 29 Sep 2023 11:56:46 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Kazatomprom-plans-2025-uranium-production-increase?feed=feed
5bd0dbc5-f2fe-4497-b118-4d20541714db Cumbrian community exits repository site searchAllerdale - one of four locations being evaluated - has been removed from the UK geological disposal facility siting process due to limited suitable geology, Nuclear Waste Services announced. It is expected that a final site selection could be a process which takes 10-15 years. Thu, 28 Sep 2023 14:45:28 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Cumbrian-community-exits-repository-site-search?feed=feed
4456dfcd-a580-4a2b-92c8-0e242cc78fac Saudi Arabia reiterates plans for nuclear energySaudi Arabia has announced it intends to move towards implementing full International Atomic Energy Agency nuclear safeguards as it works towards building its first nuclear power plant. Thu, 28 Sep 2023 14:46:17 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Saudi-Arabia-reiterates-plans-for-nuclear-energy?feed=feed
a18e6d2c-dca0-467b-9764-4590887ea5b8 Argentina and France extend nuclear collaborationArgentina's National Atomic Energy Commission and the French Alternative Energies & Atomic Energy Commission have signed a cooperation agreement on the peaceful use of nuclear technology and new energy technologies that expands on one signed in 2010. Thu, 28 Sep 2023 14:27:56 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Argentina-and-France-extend-nuclear-collaboration?feed=feed
e7cb0c6d-326b-4793-ab41-c841c2a43c8f Completion of Finnish repository review delayedFinland's Radiation and Nuclear Safety Authority said its review of Posiva Oy's operating licence application for the world's first used fuel disposal facility is taking longer than expected and will not be completed by the end of this year as planned. Thu, 28 Sep 2023 13:56:59 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Completion-of-Finnish-repository-review-delayed?feed=feed
e42aba92-4999-4b88-b431-9ddfeaf65b59 Contract signed for design of Polish nuclear power plantPolish power company Polskie Elektrownie Jądrowe has signed an engineering services contract with US firms Westinghouse Electric Company and Bechtel for the country's first nuclear power plant, to be constructed at the Lubiatowo-Kopalino site in the Choczewo municipality in Pomerania. Thu, 28 Sep 2023 13:07:57 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Contract-signed-for-design-of-Polish-nuclear-power?feed=feed
ce5e1eb5-c6c5-4496-b686-d6298db47d7a New working group aims to speed JEK2 project in SloveniaA new working group of Slovenian government ministers and industry officials has met with the aim of preparing "all the necessary bases for citizens to make high-quality and informed decisions about supporting the JEK2 project", with a planned timeline of a final investment decision by 2028 "at the latest". Thu, 28 Sep 2023 12:03:52 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/New-working-group-aims-to-speed-JEK2-project-in-Sl?feed=feed
8dbf059e-8955-4152-8ce7-4be26fd4891f Innovation is driving nuclear optimism, panel findsar innovation driving optimism, panel findsInnovation has been, and will continue to be, an essential driver in propelling the nuclear energy sector forward - but the industry must be prepared to embrace innovation in all areas, not just technological innovations. These were the messages from speakers in the high-level closing panel at the International Atomic Energy Agency's <em>2023 年科学论坛。; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 15:49:16 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Innovation-is-driving-nuclear-optimism,-panel-find?feed=feed
b1380777-a3fb-4a96-92ac-ca4090df63ad IEA sees greater role for nuclear in attaining net-zero by 2050In an update to its<em>国际能源署于 2021 年发布的净零路线图表示，鉴于最近的政策支持，核电的作用已被向上修改。在更新的净零排放情景中，核发电量到 2050 年将达到 916 GWe，高于 2021 年版本中给出的 812 GWe。; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 15:08:06 GMT https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/IEA-sees-greater-role-for-nuclear-in-attaining-net?feed=feed
